column4: are you sure they are duplicates and not a normal one and a recovery one?
I have two normal ones and two recovery ones
yes you should, because you have 2 kernels
you should also have 2 memtest because one is a normal memtest and the other is for a serial console
i see. should I remove one? or at least, how do I remove the option from the grub menu?
I'm not sure why I'd need two kernels and I'd rather they not show up when I'm booting.
if you wanted to remove the other kernel, you just need to uninstall it, but it is usually a good idea to keep at least two kernels (like you have), in case you find a bug in your current one
in that case I won't remove the old one, however, can I just change the options displayed in the grub boot menu?
unfortunately no, because they are both added by the same grub script...it is possible to do but it is a hassle, if you really want it gone you should just install the kernel
install = uninstall
you can, but it will be overwritten next grub/kernel update

you can move windows to the top if you want to, you just need to rename /etc/grub.d/30_os-prober to /etc/grub.d/09_os-prober and all the other operating systems will be at the top instead of the bottom (and since you only have windows 7, it will be windows 7, then the most recent ubuntu kernel)
you will need to edit /etc/default/grub and set GRUB_DEFAULT to 1 if you want ubuntu to stay as the default booting system
thanks, that was very helpful.
you read my mind! was about to ask :-)
I preformed the steps that you suggested and here are the results: http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/d1dda2388
the boot menu did not reflect the changes though (-_-);
by 'did not reflect the changes' I mean that windows 7 did not move to the tom of the list and grub_default still appears to be 0 (the first item)
sorry, I may just need to update-grub
worked wonderfully, thanks again
you're welcome, glad it is working
sorry I forgot to mention the sudo update-grub; part
np, thanks
